text: The numbers are “reasonable” on my laptop and on a cluster node. But this package (like the original STREAM benchmark) isn’t a straightforward “run it and read off the result” thing. For example, whether your machine write-allocates is hard (impossible?) for me / the package to know (there is a flag for it though). Also, currently the threads aren’t pinned to specific cores which might skew results on more complicated architectures (NUMA nodes). <@UAUPJLBQX> mentioned that I could try to use `JULIA_EXCLUSIVE` to improve this. Will play around with it tomorrow.
